com.sponsorpay.sdk.android.publisher
Class OfferBannerRequest

java.lang.Object
  com.sponsorpay.sdk.android.publisher.OfferBannerRequest
All Implemented Interfaces:
AsyncRequest.AsyncRequestResultListener
public class OfferBannerRequest
extends java.lang.Object
implements AsyncRequest.AsyncRequestResultListener

Requests a new offer banner to the SponsorPay server and notifies the registered SPOfferBannerListener of the result of the request.

Constructor Summary

          Initializes a new instance and sends the request immediately.

          Called by the mAsyncRequest instance when the background request's results are available.

Constructor Detail

OfferBannerRequest

public OfferBannerRequest(android.content.Context context,
                          java.lang.String credentialsToken,
                          SPOfferBannerListener listener,
                          OfferBanner.AdShape offerBannerAdShape,
                          java.lang.String currencyName,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customParams)
Initializes a new instance and sends the request immediately.

Parameters:
context - Android application context.
credentialsToken - the token ID identifying the credentials used to retrieve values.
listener - SPOfferBannerListener which will be notified of the result of the request.
offerBannerAdShape - OfferBanner.AdShape of the requested banner.
currencyName - Currency Name to be sent in the request.
customParams - A map of extra key/value pairs to add to the request URL.
Method Detail

requestOfferBanner

public void requestOfferBanner()
Generates the request URL and loads it on the background.

onAsyncRequestComplete

public void onAsyncRequestComplete(AsyncRequest request)
Called by the mAsyncRequest instance when the background request's results are available. Will notify the registered SPOfferBannerListener.

Specified by:
onAsyncRequestComplete in interface AsyncRequest.AsyncRequestResultListener

getHttpStatusCode

public int getHttpStatusCode()
Gets the HTTP status code returned as a result of this request.

getRequestThrownError

public java.lang.Throwable getRequestThrownError()
Returns the local error thrown when trying to send the request. An exception typically means that there was a problem connecting to the network, but checking the type of the returned error can give a more accurate cause for the error.
